alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 10 at 12:16PM PST until March 10 at 2:30PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 230 PM PST. * At 1216 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Three Rivers, Case Mountain, Ash Mountain Sequoia Park HQ and Potwisha Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
